For over 25 years, Shuraa Business Setup has been a trusted name in the UAE. They are a full-fledged corporate service provider that has helped over 100,000 businesses and entrepreneurs set up in mainland, free zones, or secure Golden Visas.

Behind the scenes, managing shared cards from multiple banks was slowing them down. With multiple shared cards across PRO, admin, and marketing teams, it was all too easy for receipts to slip away, OTPs to get delayed, and reconciliation to feel like a full-time job.

That changed when they switched to Alaan. Today, every team has its own Alaan card with category-based controls, real-time tracking, and 2% cashback on international spend.

This is how Shuraa brought its internal ops up to the same gold standard it delivers to clients.

Big thanks to Deep Sachdev for taking us behind the scenes at Shuraa.

Today Iâ€™m proud to announce one of the largest Series A rounds in the history of the Middle East.

Alaan has raised $48 million, led by Peak XV Partners (formerly Sequoia Capital India & SEA), with significant participation from 885 Capital, Y Combinator, 468 Capital, and Pioneer Fund. The round was heavily oversubscribed.

Weâ€™re also excited to welcome Ravishankar GV to our board, and Sudeep R. and Mato PeriÄ‡ as board observers.

In just 3 years, Alaan has grown into one of the most widely adopted fintech platforms in the UAE, serving over 1,500 businesses. Earlier this year, we began our journey in KSA. Our AI agents are already quietly helping finance teams: automating receipt matching, VAT extraction, and eliminating manual reconciliation.

With this funding, weâ€™re doubling down on AI agents to remove even more manual work and give finance teams full control over spend.
